00027   NULL,                         // exit
00028   NULL,                         // pre_bor
00029   dl40x_bor,                    // bor

00038 static struct dl401

00043   unsigned long a32_base;

00045   char odb_name[20];

00058 INT
00059 dl40x_bor ()
00060 {
00061   /*
00062    * Initialize DL403 clock generator.
00063    */
00064   if (dl403_init (&clk) != SUCCESS) {
00065     return FE_ERR_HW;
00066   }
00067 
00068   /*
00069    * Initialize DL401 FADC modules.
00070    */
00071   for (int j = 0; j < DL401_MAXMODULES; j++)
00072     {
00073       sprintf (DL401[j].odb_name, "FADC %d", j);
00074       DL401[j].enabled = FALSE;
00075 
00076       if (odb_find_key ("/Equipment/Crate %d/Settings/FADC %d", crate_number, j))
00077         {
00078           diag_print (1, "ODB says FADC #%d is present in crate 3, ", j);
00079           DL401[j].enabled =
00080             odb_get_bool ("/Equipment/Crate %d/Settings/FADC %d/enabled status",
00081                           crate_number, j);
00082           if (DL401[j].enabled)
00083             {
00084               diag_print (1, "and is enabled.  Initializing...\n");
00085               dl401_bor1 (&DL401[j]);
00086             }
00087           else
00088             {
00089               diag_print (1, "but is disabled.\n");
00090             }
00091         }
00092 
00093     }
00094 
00095   return SUCCESS;
00096 }
00097 
00098 INT
00099 dl40x_eor ()
00100 {
00101   // release VME handles
00102   if(clk.enabled) {
00103     vme_close(clk.vme_handle);
00104   }
00105 
00106   for (int j = 0; j < DL401_MAXMODULES; j++) {
00107     if(DL401[j].enabled) {
00108       vme_close(DL401[j].a16_handle);
00109       vme_close(DL401[j].a32_handle);
00110     }
00111   }
00112 
00113   return SUCCESS;
00114 }
00115 
00116 INT
00117 dl40x_read (char *pevent)
00118 {
00119   if(!clk.enabled) {
00120     return SUCCESS;
00121   }
00122 
00123   // loop over FADC banks if the clock has stopped.  Otherwise, they
00124   // aren't part of the event, because they didn't get a trigger.
00125   if (!dl403_running (&clk))
00126     {
00127       for (int j = 0; j < DL401_MAXMODULES; j++)
00128         {
00129           if (DL401[j].enabled)
00130             {
00131 #if 0
00132               // wait for the ADCs to finish converting
00133               while (!dl401_finished (&DL401[j]))
00134                 {
00135                   cm_yield(0); 
00136                 }
00137 #endif
00138 
00139               // perform readout
00140               long *pdata;
00141               char bk_name[8];
00142               int size = DL401_CNTMAX;
00143 
00144               sprintf (bk_name, "ADC%d", j);
00145               bk_create (pevent, bk_name, TID_DWORD, &pdata);
00146               size = dl401_read (&DL401[j], (u_int *) pdata);
00147               pdata += size;
00148               bk_close (pevent, pdata);
00149 
00150               // Reset for next event 
00151               dl401_reset (&DL401[j]);
00152               dl401_clear (&DL401[j]);
00153             }
00154         }
00155     }
00156 
00157   // Restart FADCs for next event
00158   dl403_start (&clk);
00159 
00160   return SUCCESS;
00161 }

00167 INT
00168 dl401_bor1 (struct dl401 *d)
00169 {
00170   // Find base addresses.  This module has separate A16 (for configuration) 
00171   // and A32 (for data memory) address regions.  The A16 address is set by
00172   // jumpers while the A32 is programmed by a register accessed through the
00173   // A16 space.
00174   d->a16_base = odb_get_word ("/Equipment/Crate %d/Settings/%s/a16 base address",
00175                               crate_number, d->odb_name);
00176   d->a32_base = odb_get_dword ("/Equipment/Crate %d/Settings/%s/a32 base address",
00177                               crate_number, d->odb_name);
00178 
00179   // Get VME handles to access module
00180   struct vme_mapping_ctrl a16_mapping = {
00181           VMEMAP_DWIDTH_32,
00182           VMEMAP_ASPACE_A16,
00183           VMEMAP_SUPUSERAM_SUPER,
00184           VMEMAP_PRGDATAAM_DATA
00185   };
00186   d->a16_handle = vme_open(d->a16_base, a16_mapping, 0x100, 0);
00187 
00188   struct vme_mapping_ctrl a32_mapping = {
00189           VMEMAP_DWIDTH_32,
00190           VMEMAP_ASPACE_A32,
00191           VMEMAP_SUPUSERAM_USER,
00192           VMEMAP_PRGDATAAM_DATA
00193   };
00194   d->a32_handle = vme_open(d->a32_base, a32_mapping, 4096, 0);
00195 
00196   // Set up the A32 base address
00197   vme_write_d16 (d->a16_handle, d->a16_base | DL401_BASE, d->a32_base >> 16);
00198 
00199   // Set up the address modifiers
00200   vme_write_d16 (d->a16_handle, d->a16_base | DL401_MASK, 
00201                  DL401_LWIOENA | DL401_AM_EXT_MODE);
00202 
00203   // Set the default mode bits
00204   vme_write_d16 (d->a16_handle, d->a16_base | DL401_MODE, DL401_DEFMODE);
00205 
00206   // find and set pedestals
00207   WORD ped[DL401_NCHAN];
00208   for (int k = 0; k < DL401_NCHAN; k++)
00209     {
00210       ped[k] = odb_get_word ("/Equipment/Crate %d/Settings/%s/Pedestal",
00211                              crate_number, d->odb_name);
00212     }
00213   dl401_setPedestals (d, ped, DL401_NCHAN);
00214 
00215   // standard reset and clear
00216   dl401_reset (d);
00217   dl401_clear (d);
00218 
00219   diag_print(2, "dl401_bor1  a32_base=0x%08lx a16_base=0x%08lx\n",
00220           d->a32_base, d->a16_base);
00221 
00222   return SUCCESS;
00223 }
00224 
00225 INLINE int
00226 dl401_setPedestals (struct dl401 *d, u_short p[], int np)
00227 {
00228   if (np != DL401_NCHAN)
00229     return (-1);
00230 
00231   // compute word to write to pedestal DAC 
00232   DWORD parPed = 0;
00233   for (int i = 0; i < np; i++) {
00234       parPed |= (u_long) (p[i] & DL401_PEDCHANMASK) << (i * DL401_PEDCHANBITS);
00235   }
00236   parPed &= DL401_PEDMASK;
00237   diag_print (2, "dl401_setPedestal: [%d] 0%08lo (", d, parPed);
00238 
00239   // enable writing to DAC
00240   vme_write_d16 (d->a16_handle, d->a16_base | DL401_MODE,
00241                  DL401_DEFMODE & DL401_DACWENA);
00242 
00243   // shift bits into DAC one at a time; it's a serial interface
00244   for (int i = 0; i < DL401_PEDBITS; i++)
00245     {
00246       u_short bit =
00247         ((parPed << i) & DL401_PEDBITMASK) >> (DL401_PEDBITS - 1);
00248       vme_write_d16 (d->a16_handle, d->a16_base | DL401_WDAC, bit & 0x0001);
00249       diag_print (2, "%1x", bit);
00250     }
00251 
00252   // disable writing to DAC
00253   vme_write_d16 (d->a16_handle, d->a16_base | DL401_MODE,
00254                  DL401_DEFMODE | DL401_DACWDIS);
00255   diag_print (2, ")\n");
00256 
00257   return SUCCESS;
00258 }

00260 INLINE u_short
00261 dl401_getCounts (struct dl401 * d)
00262 {
00263   WORD rmad = vme_read_d16 (d->a16_handle, d->a16_base | DL401_RMAD);
00264   return rmad & DL401_CNTMASK;
00265 }

00286 dl401_convert (struct dl401 *d)
00287 {
00288   vme_read_d16 (d->a16_handle, d->a16_base | DL401_ICNV);
00289 }
00290 
00291 INLINE int
00292 dl401_finished (struct dl401 *d)
00293 {
00294   WORD mode = vme_read_d16 (d->a16_handle, d->a16_base | DL401_MODE);
00295   return (mode & DL401_INTREQ);
00296 }

00299 int
00300 dl401_read (struct dl401 *d, u_int * data)
00301 {
00302   register u_int i = 0;
00303   register u_int *addr;
00304   int counts;
00305 
00306   counts = dl401_getCounts (d);
00307   diag_print (2, "dl401_read: [%d] base=%p counts=%d\n", d, addr, counts);
00308 
00309   while (i < DL401_CNTMAX - counts)
00310     {
00311       data[i++] = vme_read_d32 (d->a32_handle, d->a32_base + (i + counts)*4);
00312     }
00313 
00314   i = 0;
00315   while (i < counts)
00316     {
00317       data[DL401_CNTMAX - counts + i] =
00318         vme_read_d32 (d->a32_handle, d->a32_base + i*4);
00319       i++;
00320     }
00321   diag_print (2, "--> done\n");
00322   return (DL401_CNTMAX);
00323 }

00326 int
00327 dl401_dmaread (DL401 * d, u_int * data)
00328 {
00329   long transfersize1, transfersize2;
00330   int counts;
00331 
00332   counts = dl401_getCounts (d);
00333   printf ("dl401 counts = %d\n", counts);
00334 
00335   transfersize1 = pread (fd_a32d32_noblt,
00336                          data,
00337                          (DL401_CNTMAX - counts) * sizeof (*data),
00338                          d->dataAddr - a32_space_start + counts * 4);
00339 
00340   transfersize2 = pread (fd_a32d32_noblt,
00341                          data + DL401_CNTMAX - counts,
00342                          counts * sizeof (*data),
00343                          d->dataAddr - a32_space_start);
00344 
00345   return ((transfersize1 + transfersize2) / sizeof (*data));
00346 }

00348 
00349 /* =================================================
00350    STRUCK DL403 VME CLOCK MODULE
00351    ================================================= */
00352 INT dl403_init (struct dl403 *d)
00353 {
00354   // Do we have an FADC clock?
00355   if (odb_find_key("/Equipment/Crate %d/Settings/FADC CLOCK", crate_number)) {
00356     d->enabled = TRUE;
00357   } else {
00358     d->enabled = FALSE;
00359     return SUCCESS;
00360   }
00361 
00362   // find base address
00363   d->a16_base =
00364     odb_get_word ("/Equipment/Crate %d/Settings/FADC CLOCK/a16 base address",
00365                   crate_number);
00366 
00367   // Open a VME handle
00368   struct vme_mapping_ctrl a16_mapping = {
00369           VMEMAP_DWIDTH_32,
00370           VMEMAP_ASPACE_A16,
00371           VMEMAP_SUPUSERAM_SUPER,
00372           VMEMAP_PRGDATAAM_DATA
00373   };
00374   d->vme_handle = vme_open(d->a16_base, a16_mapping, 0x100, 0);
00375 
00376   // Set DL403 clock frequency
00377   INT fadc_frequency =
00378     odb_get_int ("/Equipment/Crate %d/Settings/FADC CLOCK/frequency", crate_number);
00379   switch (fadc_frequency)
00380     {
00381     case 100:
00382       dl403_setClockRate (d, DL403_100MHZ, 0x0, 0x0);
00383       break;
00384     case 50:
00385       dl403_setClockRate (d, DL403_50MHZ, 0x0, 0x0);
00386       break;
00387     case 25:
00388       dl403_setClockRate (d, DL403_SELECTED, 0x0, 0x0);
00389       break;
00390 
00391     default:
00392       cm_msg (MERROR, frontend_name,
00393               "FADC clock frequency must be 25, 50, or 100 MHz (currently %d)\n",
00394               fadc_frequency);
00395       dl403_setClockRate (d, DL403_50MHZ, 0x0, 0x0);
00396     }
00397 
00398   dl403_setClockCycle (d, 0x800, 0x800, 0x800);
00399   dl403_steadyMode (d);
00400   dl403_start (d);
00401 
00402   diag_print (2, "dl403_init 0x%08lx\n", d->a16_base);
00403   return SUCCESS;
00404 }
00405 
00406 void
00407 dl403_setClockRate (struct dl403 *d, u_short clk1, u_short clk2, u_short clk3)
00408 {
00409   diag_print (2, "dl403_setClockRate: [%d] rate=0x%02hx\n", d,
00410               (clk1 | (clk2 << 2) | (clk3 << 4)));
00411 
00412   vme_write_d16 (d->vme_handle, d->a16_base | DL403_RATE,
00413                  clk1 | (clk2 << 2) | (clk3 << 4));
00414 }
00415 
00416 void
00417 dl403_setClockCycle (struct dl403 *d, u_short c1, u_short c2, u_short c3)
00418 {
00419   vme_write_d16 (d->vme_handle, d->a16_base | DL403_CYCLE1, c1);
00420   vme_write_d16 (d->vme_handle, d->a16_base | DL403_CYCLE2, c2);
00421   vme_write_d16 (d->vme_handle, d->a16_base | DL403_CYCLE3, c3);
00422 
00423   diag_print (2,
00424               "dl403_setClockCycles: [%d] cyc1=0x%04hx cyc2=0x%04hx cyc3=0x%04hx\n",
00425               d, c1, c2, c3);
00426 
00427 }

00471 INLINE short
00472 dl403_runBit (struct dl403 *d)

00478 INLINE short
00479 dl403_running (struct dl403 *d)
00480 {
00481   WORD mode = vme_read_d16 (d->vme_handle, d->a16_base | DL403_MODE);
00482   return !(mode & DL403_RUN);
